to perch; to rest (of birds); to dwell; to live; to stay
садиться на насест; отдыхать (птиц); проживать; жить; остаться

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 栖)
Pictophonetic: 妻 indicates the sound; 木 (tree) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
棲息 [ qī xī ]: (of a bird) to perch; (of creatures in general) to inhabit; to dwell
棲身 [ qī shēn ]: to stay at; to live in (temporarily)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 妻 [ qī ] wife
heisig_chinese_memo: My wife wanted a special place to perch herself and roost, so I built her one - on top of that tree.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 妻 (つま、サイ жена, супруга), 凄 (さむい、すごい、セイ、サイ ужасный).
Ru_Radicals: 十 (десять), 女 (женщина), ヨ, 木 (дерево)
Ru_trainchinese: qī: (графема) (о птицах) сидеть (на насесте, дереве и т.д.), гнездиться
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the wife (妻) in the tree (木) dwells there
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: For nestling, the west side of the tree is best – otherwise you get woken up by the sun and the loud birds perched next to you enjoying it.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Riscus " is originally " West ", which means that the moon has set in the west and the bird has entered the nest. "Said Wen": "West, the bird is on the nest.... Qi, Xi or Congmu, Wife." The Qin characters of the Warring States were changed from " wood " to " wife " sound, as " qi ". The original meaning is birds resting. Such as "Poetry. Wang Feng. The Gentleman in Service": "The chickens live in the colony; the sheep and cattle come down on the eve of the sun." "Huainanzi. "Qi Su": "Husbands and birds dominate the nest, foxes dominate the nest, the nester builds the nest and gets the habitation, and the burrower builds the nest and gets the residence."

After " habiting ", it generally refers to living and staying. Such as "Mandarin. "Vietnamese": "Yuewang sentence is built on top of Kuaiji." Wei Zhao's note: "Mountain is called habitat." "Zhuangzi. "Mountain and Wood": "Fufeng, fox and leopard, living in the mountains and forests, lying in a cave, quiet."

" Habitat " also refers to a place to stay and rest. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Qin Ceyi": "The princes cannot be one, even the chicken can not stop at the clearness of the habitat." Bao Biao's note: "The habitat of the chicken is also the place." "Lun Heng. "Differentiation": "Birds have nests, beasts have caves, insects, fish and scales, each with its own districts, and even people have houses and terraces."

" Habitat " also specifically refers to the bed. "Guang Ya. "Shiqi": "The bed of habitation." Such as "Mencius. "Wan Zhang Shang": "Second Sister-in-law Governs Zhen Xi." Zhao Qi's note: "Xi, bed.

" Habitat " also means hoarding, hoarding. For example, in the Tang Dynasty Cheng Hao's "Xiangzhou Gongyantang": "The soldiers were dissatisfied with one hundred at the time, and the horses were only a few of them. The family had only a small amount of food. There was only a blockage left in the house. policy. Another example is Liu Zongyuan's "Shun Temple Praying Essay": "The surplus grain is not harmful, and the surplus grain can live."
humanum_short_description_en: " Habitat " is originally " West ", which means that the moon has set in the west and the bird has entered the nest. In the Warring States Period, the Qin family characters were changed from " wood ", " wives " to " qi ". The original meaning is birds resting.
humanum_full_description:
「棲」本作「西」，表示月已西落，鳥已入巢。《說文》：「西，鳥在巢上。……棲，西或从木、妻。」戰國秦系文字改為從「木」，「妻」聲，作「棲」。本義是鳥類歇宿。如《詩．王風．君子于役》：「鷄棲于塒；日之夕矣，羊牛下來。」《淮南子．齊俗》：「夫飛鳥主巢，狐狸主穴，巢者巢成而得棲焉，穴者穴成而得宿焉。」

　　「棲」後泛指居住、停留。如《國語．越語》：「越王句踐棲於會稽之上。」韋昭注：「山處曰棲。」《莊子．山木》：「夫豐狐文豹，棲於山林，伏於巖穴，靜也。」

　　「棲」亦指停留歇息的地方。如《戰國策．秦策一》：「諸侯不可一，猶連鷄之不能俱止於棲之明矣。」鮑彪注：「棲，鷄所宿也。」《論衡．辨祟》：「鳥有巢棲，獸有窟穴，蟲魚介鱗，各有區處，猶人之有室宅樓臺也。」

　　「棲」又特指牀。《廣雅．釋器》：「棲謂之牀。」如《孟子．萬章上》：「二嫂使治朕棲。」趙岐注：「棲，牀也。」

　　「棲」還表示囤積、囤放。如唐代程浩〈相州公宴堂記〉：「時兵不滿百，馬惟數駟，府微棲糧，家僅餘堵，公乃掃除粃政，濟活人命。」「粃政」即不好的政策。又如柳宗元〈舜廟祈晴文〉：「粢盛不害，餘糧可棲。」
humanum_short_description: 「棲」本作「西」，表示月已西落，鳥已入巢。戰國秦系文字改為從「木」，「妻」聲，作「棲」。本義是鳥類歇宿。

②居留，停留：棲身。棲息。棲止。棲遁(隱居，遁世)。棲遲(遊息，居住)。

「 棲 」本作「 西 」，表示月已西落，鳥已入巢。《說文》：「西，鳥在巢上。……棲，西或从木、妻。」戰國秦系文字改為從「 木 」，「 妻 」聲，作「 棲 」。本義是鳥類歇宿。如《詩．王風．君子于役》：「鷄棲于塒；日之夕矣，羊牛下來。」《淮南子．齊俗》：「夫飛鳥主巢，狐狸主穴，巢者巢成而得棲焉，穴者穴成而得宿焉。」 「 棲 」後泛指居住、停留。如《國語．越語》：「越王句踐棲於會稽之上。」韋昭注：「山處曰棲。」《莊子．山木》：「夫豐狐文豹，棲於山林，伏於巖穴，靜也。」 「 棲 」亦指停留歇息的地方。如《戰國策．秦策一》：「諸侯不可一，猶連鷄之不能俱止於棲之明矣。」鮑彪注：「棲，鷄所宿也。」《論衡．辨祟》：「鳥有巢棲，獸有窟穴，蟲魚介鱗，各有區處，猶人之有室宅樓臺也。」 「 棲 」又特指牀。《廣雅．釋器》：「棲謂之牀。」如《孟子．萬章上》：「二嫂使治朕棲。」趙岐注：「棲，牀也。」 「 棲 」還表示囤積、囤放。如唐代程浩〈相州公宴堂記〉：「時兵不滿百，馬惟數駟，府微棲糧，家僅餘堵，公乃掃除粃政，濟活人命。」「粃政」即不好的政策。又如柳宗元〈舜廟祈晴文〉：「粢盛不害，餘糧可棲。」

The Qin characters of the Warring States were changed from " wood" to " wife" sound, as " qi". The original meaning is birds resting. Such as "Poetry. Wang Feng. The Gentleman in Service": "The chickens live in the colony; the sheep and cattle come down on the eve of the sun." "Huainanzi. "Qi Su": "Husbands and birds dominate the nest, foxes dominate the nest, the nester builds the nest and gets the habitation, and the burrower builds the nest and gets the residence." After " habiting", it generally refers to living and staying. Such as "Mandarin. "Vietnamese": "Yuewang sentence is built on top of Kuaiji." Wei Zhao's note: "Mountain is called habitat." "Zhuangzi. "Mountain and Wood": "Fufeng, fox and leopard, living in the mountains and forests, lying in a cave, quiet." " Habitat" also refers to a place to stay and rest. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Qin Ceyi": "The princes cannot be one, even the chicken can not stop at the clearness of the habitat." Bao Biao's note: "The habitat of the chicken is also the place." "Lun Heng. "Differentiation": "Birds have nests, beasts have caves, insects, fish and scales, each with its own districts, and even people have houses and terraces." " Habitat" also specifically refers to the bed. "Guang Ya. "Shiqi": "The bed of habitation." Such as "Mencius. "Wan Zhang Shang": "Second Sister-in-law Governs Zhen Xi." Zhao Qi's note: "Xi, bed. " Habitat" also means hoarding, hoarding. For example, in the Tang Dynasty Cheng Hao's "Xiangzhou Gongyantang": "The soldiers were dissatisfied with one hundred at the time, and the horses were only a few of them. The family had only a small amount of food. There was only a blockage left in the house. policy. Another example is Liu Zongyuan's "Shun Temple Praying Essay": "The surplus grain is not harmful, and the surplus grain can live."

棲字的基本解释

棲
qī
同“栖1”。

棲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qī］
［《廣韻》先稽切，平齊，心。］
亦作“捿1”。亦作“栖1”。
(1)禽鸟歇宿。
(2)居住；停留。
(3)引申谓投身、附身。
(4)居处歇息的地方。
(5)床。古代坐卧之具。
(6)附着。
(7)囤放；囤积。
[②]［xī］
［《集韻》千西切，平齊，清。］
亦作“悽2”。亦作“栖1”。亦作“栖2”。

棲字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　棲； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页534第17
【玉篇】同栖。鳥棲也。　又【博雅】棲謂之牀。【詩·陳風】衡門之下，可以棲遲。　又草名。【詩·大雅】如彼棲苴。【傳】水中浮草曰棲苴。　又【集韻】【類篇】?千西切，音妻。棲棲，簡閱車馬貌。【詩·小雅】六月棲棲，戎車旣飭。　又棲屑，往來貌。【後魏·裴安傳】京師遼遠，實憚棲屑。

棲字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
棲字的起名意思

暂无。

Habitat
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qī］
["Guang Yun" first check and cut, level, and heart. ]
Also known as "snap 1". Also known as "Hang 1".
(1) Birds and birds rest.
(2) Residence; stay.
(3) By extension, devotion and possession.
(4) A place to rest.
(5) Bed. Ancient sitting and lying tools.
(6) Attachment.
(7) Hoarding; hoarding.
[②]［xī］
["Jiyun" Qianxiqie, level and clear. ]
Also known as "Chill 2". Also known as "Hang 1". Also known as "Shu 2".
Habitat
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　淇; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 534 Page 17
[Jade articles] The same habitat. Tosuya.　[Bo Ya] The bed of Qizhi. [Poetry·Chen Feng] Under Hengmen, you can stay late.　Also cursive name. 【Poetry·Daya】Like Heqiju. [Biography] Floating grass in the water is called roosting scroph.　[Jiyun] [Class Chapter]? Qianxiqie, wife of sound. Habitat, briefly read the appearance of carriages and horses. [Poetry·Xiaoya] In June, there is a roost in the roost, and the horseman's chariot is beautiful.　Scatter again, exchange appearances. [Post-Wei Pei An Biography] The capital was far away, and it was real crumbs.
